Case reference: 2006005799.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1993, the right foot of an adult, washed ashore on the south side of Pelee Island, which is in Lake Erie, Ontario. The foot was contained in a white cotton sock and an LA Gear running shoe, size 8. A search of the area failed to locate any other remains. There is limited information available on this case.

Shoes: High top running shoe, "L.A. Gear" brand, size 8

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Berenice and Berangere Pare were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Berenice and Berangere, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: Hellen Ermias and her daughter Lina Tedros entered Canada seeking asylum.  They were provided a temporary apartment but disappeared shortly after with no explanation and without their belongings.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)
Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent

Case reference: 2008023399.CaseDesc: Christine Ziomkiewicz was last seen on June 23, 1978, by co-workers at Queen's University, where she worked as a laboratory technician. Her vehicle was still in the building’s parking lot and there was nothing to indicate she had left intentionally for any period of time. She is not believed to have been in a relationship at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000117.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1960, police received a report of a lost child in the Red Lake area, 72 km Northwest of Kamloops. 21-month-old Edna Bette-Jean Masters known to the family as Bette-Jean, was last seen playing with family and friends at a friend's residence.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Oval shape burn scar
Deformity: Ears, Slight bent ear lobe, unknown which ear

Case reference: 2019037175.CaseDesc: On April 8, 2005, the blood and brain matter from a male was found on the outer deck of a ferry travelling from Horseshoe Bay to Departure Bay in British Columbia. A loaded revolver with one spent round was found nearby. He may have worn a black leather cap, and was likely despondent when last seen alive.

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014004137.CaseDesc: On the night of October 5, 1976, Jean-Luc Ringuette was seen for the last time when he left his home in Sainte-Anne-de-Madawaska, New Brunswick. The following morning, Jean-Luc did not attend school. A few weeks prior to his disappearance, he had disclosed that he had some money, and that he and a friend were going to leave town.

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing

Case reference: 2012020036.CaseDesc: Monique Mattar has not been seen since April 20, 2009. She was known to lead a high risk lifestyle. Police investigations in regards to the whereabouts of Monique Mattar are ongoing.

Case reference: 2005003499.CaseDesc: On July 22, 2002, a Caucasian male, was found in the Niagara River, near the Queenston Dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 187 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present. He may have been a smoker. He was likely in the water for a few days at most.

Hair: Brown, Shorter than collar length, receding hair line
Teeth: He has natural teeth with some amalgam and composite resin restorations

Case reference: 2020006631.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1980, Alan Hood was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Alan was despondent.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants

Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2014004517.CaseDesc: Edmee (Eva) Mitchell, 83 years old, went missing on August 20, 2004. Mrs. Mitchell was last seen at her rural residence near Kelly Lake, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005315.CaseDesc: Darryl Dubitski was last seen by his family leaving his residence in Edmonton, Alberta in December of 1982. Darryl had informed his family that he was travelling to the United States.

Case reference: 2014033444.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 2, 1979, Michel Pelletier, and his older sister, were seen for the last time playing in their relatives’ backyard in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On July 13, 1979, the body of Michel’s sister was found in the St-Lawrence River, however he has not been found.

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 1987203340.CaseDesc: Joanne Pedersen went missing on February 19, 1983, near her home at Vedder Crossing (Chilliwack). She was last seen with an adult male at a telephone booth.

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2014001540.CaseDesc: Marie Laliberté was a resident of east Vancouver who was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was last seen by her resource worker on January 1, 1997. Due to her increasingly sporadic contact with family and a lack of social interaction with others, she was not reported missing until March 8, 2002.

Case reference: 2006004399.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1970, Eldie Martin Sylvester attended the docks at Cedar Point, Georgian Bay, Ontario to await the "scoot" to Christian Island.  Witnesses believe that he may have left on foot to walk home to Christian Island across the ice. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019068654.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2019, Lara Parkin was seen for the last time in the South-West District of Montreal, Quebec. Lara is known to frequent Montreal’s downtown area and parks. She is also known to travel by foot or by public transit. During the time of her disappearance, Lara left her apartment without bringing any of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014002305.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Dennis Howe was seen for the last time at his place of work at 333 Spadina Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014003950.CaseDesc: Lyndon Fuller was last seen on November 25, 1988, in the area of the local hospital in Berwick, Nova Scotia. Lyndon had jumped from a third floor window following his admission to the hospital. Lyndon left on foot in an unknown direction.

Case reference: 2020011478.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1988, Mary McCarthy was seen for the last time at her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Mary’s vehicle was later found on November 17, 1988 at the bus depot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mary was a chartered accountant working for CSA Management Ltd. at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000023.CaseDesc: Marilyn Ann Hersey left the Abbey Lane Hospital on January 28, 2006, and hasn't been seen since.  Marilyn is bi-polar and had to take medication for numerous ailments; she did not have her medication with her.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004459.CaseDesc: In the late summer of 1998, Charles Trottier was last seen by his family on the Kehewin Cree First Nations Reserve, near Bonneville, Alberta. Charles may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2018020521.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2018, Shaun “Sandy” Mullen was last seen leaving the West Parry Sound Health Centre in Parry Sound, Ontario. Police have reason to believe that Shaun accessed a taxi and returned to his Parry Sound residence prior to his disappearance shortly thereafter. Shaun has past tendencies to visit friends or go camping for extended periods of time but there is no indication this is the case.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2014003777.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1988, François Piquet was seen for the last time when he left the family residence located in the Saint-Laurent district of Montreal, Quebec. François left his ID cards behind and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002241.CaseDesc: In April of 1972, Velma Marie Duncan was last seen by her brother hitchhiking from the Gang Ranch area to Williams Lake, BC. Ms. Duncan arrived at her sister’s residence and attended the downtown core of Williams Lake with her sister on May 3rd or 4th, 1972. Ms. Duncan entered a local bar, which was the last time she was seen.

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006012599.CaseDesc: Ralph Grant was last seen in the Huntsville area between January 28 and February 22, 1999. He resided on Yearly Road, Huntsville.

Amputation: Lower jaw surgically removed due to cancer

Case reference: 2014004274.CaseDesc: Frédéric Cormier was last seen on January 11, 2001, in the Vieux-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. Frédéric would pick up his son once a week, but he has had no contact since this date.

Case reference: 2021000929.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2020, Ronald O'Kell was reported missing to the New York State Police in Niagara Falls, New York. Ronald’s unoccupied vehicle was recovered from a parking lot on Goat Island, New York. It is suspected that he may have jumped into the falls.

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Case reference: 2018063054.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2018, Djvaid Ashami was seen for the last time as he left Montreal, Quebec, to go to Germany to join his father. On July 5, 2018, Djvaid and his father left Germany to go to the Shahre Naow District in Kabul, Afghanistan. The duo had planned to stay there until July 14. However, on July 11, Djavid left his hotel room for unknown reasons and without telling his father he was leaving. He has not been seen and his family has not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014028357.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2014, Meysam Mokri was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Port Moody, British Columbia with a duffel bag containing some of his clothing. Meysam has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Leather, White, Runners, Air Jordan brand, size 9

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2013000135.CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.

Case reference: 2008000798.CaseDesc: Clare Kelly is schizophrenic, was not taking medications and was known to be despondent. She had a fascination with several relatives' deaths involving water. When picked up from Niagara Falls the previous week she said, "God told me to throw my body on the rocks to free my soul."

Coat: Blue, Bomber style parka with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2014005268.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2009, Harold Dorion was reported missing to the Nelson House RCMP. Investigation later identified that Mr. Dorion was last seen the last week of July 2007. Since that time, Mr. Dorion has not been seen or heard of. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carlton Place, Ontario. Ms. Roy has lived in Carlton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Quebec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2016069646.CaseDesc: James Kunuk was reported missing by his landlord in December, 2016.  He was last seen by his family on September 21st, 2016 in Whitehorse, Yukon.  Mr. Kunuk has previously lived in downtown Vancouver, and also has family connections to the Northwest Territories.  He did not contact his family for his birthday, or over the Christmas holidays, which is unusual for him.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross with "Life" written on it

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2020008535.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1991, at approximately 1:00pm, Martin Stocker was last seen at his retirement home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005701.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2011, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Dezso Junaszka was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go to work in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Denim, Blue, Brown, Large white logo on the back and left breast "UNK"
Shoes: White, Running, Running shoes; possibly "Puma" brand

Case reference: 2014004684.CaseDesc: Mr. Claude Gagné disappeared from the sector of Lac des Passes in a forested area near the municipality of La Tuque between September 1st and 2nd, 2000. His boat was found on the shore of the lake with the electric motor at the running position, and his car was found parked at the camp at the same lake. He went to the camp by himself and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top

Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014005651.CaseDesc: On May 10th 1969, Lorie Lewis, 7, was reported missing from the city of Squamish. She was last seen on the same day by her siblings of similar age, playing near a beach on the Cheekeye River, upstream of its confluence with the Cheakamus River. At the time, the water run off was swift, and Lorie is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002883.CaseDesc: George Myrick was last seen on March 16, 1987, when he went duck hunting, but he never returned to St. Shott’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2017023444.CaseDesc: In July 1948, June Pauline Stevens was living in Cadillac, Saskatchewan when she disappeared and has not been heard from since. Ms. Stevens was thought to have travelled west to Port Alberni, BC to join her mother or to Winnipeg, MB to join other relatives.

Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2005006899.CaseDesc: On July 16, 1980, the skeletal remains of an unidentified man were found in a bush area on the east side of the 11th Concession, 1km north of Steeles Avenue in Markham. This man is believed to be between the ages of 30 to 50 years. His living height is estimated to be between 5'1"-5'5". Dark staining of his posterior teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. Found in the vicinity of the remains were some clothing and effects, which may or may not be associated with the deceased. The clothing found included a pair of "Brittania" women's jeans (waist 30 inches, inseam 29 inches); a pair of white, ribbed socks; and a pair of red and pink high-heeled shoes. A compact containing powder and mirror was also found nearby. This man was believed to have been dead for 6 months to five years.

Teeth: Some of his teeth have fillings and some appear to have been extracted a number of years before death

Case reference: 2016061088.CaseDesc:
On April 25, 1982, the remains of a Black female were found in the Detroit River, near Maple Leaf Mills processing plant, in the city of Windsor, Ontario. Her appendix was present.
She is estimated to have been in the water for 2-4 weeks.

Pants: Beige, Red, Checkered pants with an elastic waist band
Jacket: Light Blue, White, Waist length button down jacket with white edging. Burn mark on the right sleeve.

Tattoo: Right Thigh, Mid-thigh, described as a "Bulls Eye", with the word "Lots" or "Lets"
Scar: Left Chest, 42 cm Thoracotomy scar with metal surgical sutures

Case reference: 2006019899.CaseDesc: Frank Uncapher was last seen on Lac Seul on October 21, 1974. He was on a hunting trip.

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2020010906.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1987, at approximately 7:00am, Christopher Dodd was seen for the last time in Toronto. His vehicle was subsequently located in an impound lot in New York, USA.

Case reference: 2013000062.CaseDesc: Leonard Pinnock has been missing since March 27, 2011. He is originally from Jamaica. He came to visit his family in Montreal and he never made it to the meeting place. He was last seen in the area of Notre-Dame-de Grâce in Montreal, Quebec. He travels between Toronto, Ontario, Montreal and Jamaica.

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2014002718.CaseDesc: Wayne Robinson was last seen on October 8, 1985, running away from his school in God's Lake, Manitoba. It is unclear what prompted Wayne to leave school during the recess period. An extensive air, water and land search was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2014006246.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1991, Jason O'Donaghey's roommate reported him missing as he had not been seen for 3 days. There were rumours that Jason left North Vancouver voluntarily, but his whereabouts are still unknown. He was a talented artist who may be making a living by selling aboriginal carvings.

Hair: Black, Long, Short on top, long at bottom

Shirt: Cotton, White, Dress shirt with longsleeve

Case reference: 2018063007.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1998, Anne Smythe was seen for the last time by her daughter, in Toronto, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Anne was headed in the direction of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006018999.CaseDesc: Sean MacIntyre was 13 years old at the time of a boating accident on July 25, 1980. The boat he was in started to take on water just after leaving Cockburn Island. The boat sank quickly in Lake Huron, North Channel, 2 kilometres Southwest of Bigsby Island. Occupants of the boat put on life jackets. Sean slipped out of his life jacket and is presumed  drowned. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2006022999.CaseDesc: Spike Jorgenson was last seen crossing Chief Bay, Lake Nipigon in a canoe on September 28, 1973. It is believed that his canoe capsized, and he is presumed drowned.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, at the second joint

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2018007092.CaseDesc: On February 8, 2018, at approximately 4:15pm, Wenting Liu was seen for the last time at Yorkdale Mall in Toronto, Ontario. Wenting was visiting Canada and failed to board her returning flight on February 10.

Coat: Pink, Puffy with fur hood and knee length

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2014002692.CaseDesc: Between September 3 and October 3, 1978, Jean-Jacques Sirois was seen for the last time in the Rosemont District in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with rectangular cubic zirconia

Case reference: 2020010632.CaseDesc: April Parisian was last seen at Yale, British Columbia, on or about March 28, 2021. April has not been seen or heard since.

Case reference: 2006001699.CaseDesc:
On July 27, 1992, the body of a male, believed to be Caucasian, was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His upper right central incisor had a root canal treatment and there was a metallic restoration at its root end. There were several other sites of root canal treatment.
His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Teeth: Many post. teeth & U-left lat. incisor:missing before death. Many fillings amalgam & composite. U-right cent. incisor: grey

Shoes: Blue and white "L.A. Gear" running shoes
Shirt: Black, T-shirt, "True North Sweats Designer " brand

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2014004759.CaseDesc: On the 21st day of March, 2006, Tayven BEAR was playing with two other children on the ice of the Churchill River in Sandy Bay. Tayven fell into the river and his body was never recovered.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing 4 front upper teeth

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, Waist length ski jacket

Case reference: 2014005316.CaseDesc: On March 31, 2002, Jenifer Morse was seen for the last time when she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.
